title: A second woman has accused ‘The Fast And The Furious’ director of sexual assault
text:
A woman has accused Rob Cohen, of "Fast and the Furious" and "XXX" directing fame, of sexual assault.

The Huffington Post reports that a woman identified only as "28-year-old Jane" claims Cohen assaulted her in a hotel room after a business meeting in New York.

At some point during the evening 2015 meeting, the woman alleges that she lost consciousness after drinking with Cohen, after which she woke up naked in his hotel room to him sexually assaulting her.

The woman first confronted Cohen after accusations against disgraced producer Harvey Weinstein and pursued further action after his daughter accused him of assault in February 2019.

A woman has accused Rob Cohen, of the original "The Fast and the Furious" and "XXX" directing fame, of sexual assault.

The Huffington Post reports that a woman identified only as "28-year-old Jane" claimed Cohen assaulted her in a hotel room after a 2015 business meeting in New York, during which he pressured her to drink as the evening meeting dragged on into the night.

At some point during the meeting that was concerning a possible television project, Jane alleged that she lost consciousness while drinking with Cohen, after which she woke up naked in his hotel room to him sexually assaulting her.

HuffPost reported that she jolted out of the hotel bed, threw up in the bathroom, and returned "fuzzy" in the head, after which Cohen attempted to assault her again. She later left the hotel.

Cohen's lawyer told the Post that the director recalls meeting Jane at a bar in 2015, but denies being in a hotel room with her or sexually assaulting her. The Post reported that medical records confirmed that she immediately sought treatment for sexual assault after the alleged incident and confided in two people about what she came to regard as an assault.

About two years after the incident, numerous accusations of sexual assault and harassment against producing mogul Harvey Weinstein persuaded Jane to text Cohen about the incident.

"The night we met, you really hurt me and f----d me up," she wrote, according to the Post. Cohen reportedly responded that he was "So sorry to hear this," before he called her the next day, and allegedly apologized for "causing her pain."

Cohen told the Post through his lawyer that his apology pertained to his thinking that she was unhappy with the money she received on the now-defunct project.

Jane told the Post she left the matter rest after the exchange, but decided to pursue more action when Cohen's daughter, Valkyrie Weather, alleged her father had assaulted her when she was a child. Weather detailed her allegations in an account posted to Facebook, Twitter, and Reddit.

Read more: The daughter of the 'Fast and the Furious' director is accusing him of sexually assaulting her when she was 2 years old

Weather accused her father molesting her when she was two years old, allegedly taking her to visit prostitutes in Asia and eastern Europe when she was underage, and openly bragging about sexually assaulting an unidentified woman.

"When I was very young, Rob used my body for his own sexual gratification. My mother witnessed one of the assaults when I was between two and two-and-a-half years old, and has since confirmed what she saw," Weather wrote in the original post.

Cohen flatly denied the allegations in multiple statements, as Jane connected with Weather over Facebook Messenger about the allegations.
